page.title: 07Library Services in Skegness
page.content: In 1928 the library opened in the old town hall.It transferred to Lincoln Road and they had voluntary helpers until 1942.In 1946 the library employed staff and in 1947 they moved to Roman Bank.Mrs Jenkins was the old librarian.The library has had lots of alterations.Seven people are employed and two are relief staff.There are 15 848 books on the shelves there are 11 685 on issue, there are 11 823in reserve which makes a total of 39 356.There is a photocopying service, music and drama,local information, reference, cassettes of books and a meeting place.There are 6219 adults' books and 1505 children's books.One book can cost up to Â£144.There is a Micro Fishe reader.A Micro Fishe reader tells the name of the author and the subject from a small plastic file.
